intro: Astracantha terekensis, commonly known as the Terek's Astracantha, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny fruit structures. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of white or pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
